channel.title: Can you make a RSPS using a programing language other than java?
channel.description:
well can you??
Edit: but wont you guys need to write your own client in that language so it would be compatible with the server after all as far as i know all clients are written in java language

item.title: Can you make a RSPS using a programing language other than java?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:13, topic:370872”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=466964.msg3415487#msg3415487 date=1291019483]

Related:

I’m writing a server in Ruby, though I only update it when I have the time.

yew hang around Mopman to much
[/quote]
I’m doing this just for learning purposes and the lulz. I sense people ragin’ already![/quote]

gl

Read full topic

item.source: Can you make a RSPS using a programing language other than java?

item.title: Can you make a RSPS using a programing language other than java?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

any language that can listen and accept connections on the port has the potential to make an rsps, however using a shitty, slow primarily interpreted language and a poorly thought out design is bound to be less stable and slower than something that’s natively or bytecode compiled using a well thought out design.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

i r gon maek s3rvba w/ lolcodes

No, but in all seriousness, there are many.

[quote=“n10si t, post:3, topic:370872”]I Vain I is currently working on a RSPS using Python.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,466064.0.html[/quote]

This one looks quite good.
